plugin.commands.name: onMessageFromHTMLView

plugin.commands.name: addTask

plugin.commands.name: addChecklist
plugin.commands.description: HTML window entry point to interactively add a new checklist

plugin.settings.title: Show referenced items in separate section?
plugin.settings.description:
Whether to show Today's open tasks and checklists in two separate sections: first from the daily note itself, and second referenced from project notes.
The same also goes for Weekly/Monthly/Quarterly notes.

plugin.settings.title: Ignore checklist items
plugin.settings.description: If set, only tasks are included in any of the sections.

plugin.settings.title: Ignore items with this phrase
plugin.settings.description: If set, open tasks/checklists with this word or tag will be ignored, and not counted as open or closed. This is useful for situations where completing the item is outside your control.

plugin.settings.title: Folders to ignore when finding linked items
plugin.settings.description: Comma-separated list of folder(s) to ignore when searching for open or closed tasks/checklists. This is useful where you are using sync'd lines in search results.

plugin.settings.title: Include context for tasks?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to show the note link for an open task or checklist

plugin.settings.title: Add dashboard auto-update trigger when dashboard opened?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to add the auto-update trigger to the frontmatter to the current note when the dashboard is opened

plugin.settings.title: Exclude tasks that include time blocks?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to stop display of open tasks that contain a time block

plugin.settings.title: Exclude checklists that include time blocks?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to stop display of open checklists that contain a time block

plugin.settings.title: Include folder name?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to include the folder name when showing a note link

plugin.settings.title: Max number of items to show in a section?
plugin.settings.description: The Dashboard isn't designed to show very large numbers of tasks. This gives the maximum number of items that will be shown at one time in the Overdue and Tag sections.

plugin.settings.title: Theme to use for Dashboard
plugin.settings.description:
If this is set to a valid Theme name from among those you have installed, this Theme will be used instead of your current Theme.
Leave blank to use your current Theme.

plugin.settings.title: Show section for Yesterday?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to show a 'Yesterday' section for Yesterday's open items, after the 'Today' section.

plugin.settings.title: Show section for Week?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to show a 'Week' section for Week's open items, after the 'Today' section.

plugin.settings.title: Show section for Month?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to show a 'Month' section for open items in this month's calendar note

plugin.settings.title: Show section for Quarter?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to show a 'Qaurter' section for open items in this quarter's calendar note

plugin.settings.title: Show section for Overdue tasks?
plugin.settings.description:
If true then an 'Overdue' section is added, and the following 2 settings will be used.
Note: if set, then for performance reasons, this section will not be shown when a refresh is triggered automatically by a change in today's note.

plugin.settings.title: Update Overdue section when triggered?
plugin.settings.description: If true then the 'Overdue' section will be updated even when the update comes from being triggered by a change to the daily note.

plugin.settings.title: Sort order for Overdue tasks
plugin.settings.description: The order to show the Overdue tasks: 'priority' shows the higher priority (from `>>`, `!!!`, `!!` and `!` markers), 'earliest' by earliest modified date of the note, or 'most recent' changed note.

plugin.settings.title: #tag/@mention to show
plugin.settings.description:
If this is set as a #hashtag or @mention, then all open tasks that contain it are shown in a separate section. This is a good way to show all `#next` actions, for example. (It is limited hashtags and mentions for speed.)
Note: this could show tasks duplicated from other sections.

plugin.settings.title: Log Level
plugin.settings.description:
Set how much logging output will be displayed when executing Tidy commands in NotePlan Plugin Console Logs (NotePlan -> Help -> Plugin Console)

 - DEBUG: Show All Logs
 - INFO: Only Show Info, Warnings, and Errors
 - WARN: Only Show Errors or Warnings
 - ERROR: Only Show Errors
 - none: Don't show any logs

plugin.settings_dsiabled.title: Show extra buttons for overdue tasks?
plugin.settings_dsiabled.description:
Show experimental extra control buttons on overdue tasks:
- toggle between checklist and todo types
- mark the task complete at the date it was due (not today).
